definition: to lay down/to put down/to let go of/to relinquish/to set aside/to lower (the blinds etc)
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to lay down a heavy burden
lay down butcher's knife, become a Buddha on the spot (idiom); instant rehabilitation/to repent and be absolved of one's crimes
pinyin: fang4 xia4 tu2 dao1 , li4 di4 cheng2 fo2

definition: to get off one's high horse (idiom)/to dispense with posturing (and adopt a more humble or empathetic attitude)

sentences.english: And when finally I put it down, my mind was totally refreshed.
sentences.chinese: 最后放下书来时，我倦意全消，身心为之一爽。

sentences.english: After leaving the smell of land behind him, he set his lines.
sentences.chinese: 在把陆地的气息抛在身后之后，他放下了钓丝。

sentences.english: And so she released him to be with those who resonated with his path.
sentences.chinese: 所以她放下了他，让他和那些与他道路共振的人同行。

sentences.english: Lisa out to explain to the qin guess, hope he put down the prejudice against the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 塔利莎出去向秦猜解释，希望他放下对阿展的偏见。

sentences.english: Drop the gun, and no funny stuff!
Lower down and secure all derricks and report.
Let your work be, bride, the guest has come in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 放下亩裟工作吧，新娘，客人在晚上来了。

sentences.english: Suddenly the father put down a bowl chopsticks, son some surprise gain ground.
sentences.chinese: 忽然父亲放下碗筷，儿女有些惊喜地抬头。

sentences.english: If they want to participate in the political life of their country, they must disarm.
sentences.chinese: 他们如果希望参与本国的政治生活，就必须放下武器。

sentences.english: It’s not appropriate to leave queues of taxpayers and go for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 放下排长队的纳税人去吃午饭这实在是不怎么合适。

sentences.english: Drop what you're doing, and experience something joyful.
sentences.chinese: 放下你现在所做的事，去体验快乐吧。

sentences.english: The words are some fancies that tie up Mian, the left Zheng feels throat some Yangs Yang, the eyelid lets go of.
sentences.chinese: 话有些缠绵意，左筝觉得嗓子有些痒痒，眼帘放下。

sentences.english: And that is how illusion and delusion vanishes .
sentences.chinese: 唯有放下，所有幻觉与假相才得以消失。

sentences.english: Creak, Alis puts down a black.
Who was revealed to be a Cylon in "Lay Down Your Burdens"?
sentences.chinese: 谁在“放下你的负担“一集中被发线是CYLON？

definition: to pick up
not to have room to put sth/to be unable to let go
to be able to accomodate/to have room for/to be able to put (sth) down
to stop
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
relieved/at ease/feel relieved
to throw down/to dump/to abandon/thrown down
to unload
to let go one's hold/to give up/to have a free hand
to forget
